definition: Jiang Yan has exhausted his talent (idiom)/fig. to have used up one's creative powers/to have writer's block
river/CL:條|条[tiao2],道[dao4]
surname Jiang
(arch.) minister/official/noun prefix denoting function or status/a youth
surname Lang
ability/talent/sb of a certain type/a capable individual/only/only then/just now
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely

sentences.english: No wonder people are wondering whether Zhang Yimou is too spent after the Olympic Ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 難怪，大家懷疑張藝謀是否在奧運後已經江郎才盡。

sentences.english: This advertiser seems to have exhausted his wits.
sentences.chinese: 這個廣告人似乎是江郎才盡了。

sentences.english: The productive writer cannot produce any more works now.
sentences.chinese: 此高產作家現在已經是江郎才盡了。

sentences.english: The write's recent book shows that he is at the end of his tether.
sentences.chinese: 寫的最新著作，反映了他在江郎才盡。

definition: to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to force someone to do something
not much to choose between the two/tweedledum and tweedledee
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
reckless/extremely daring
not one good point/everything about it is wrong
lit. not eating the food of common mortals/fig. placing oneself above the common populace
pinyin: bu4 shi2 ren2 jian1 yan1 huo3

definition: nonsense/ridiculous talk/hogwash
to talk about this and that (idiom); to ramble incoherently
lit. a deluge of heavenly flowers (idiom)/fig. extravagant embellishments/hype
lit. doesn't hurt, doesn't tickle (idiom); sth is wrong, but not quite sure what/fig. not getting to any matter of substance/scratching the surface/superficial/perfunctory
see 驢唇不對馬嘴|驴唇不对马嘴[lu:2 chun2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3]
pinyin: niu2 tou2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3

definition: to feel disheartened
unlucky
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
voice change (at puberty)/to alter one's voice (deliberately)/to sound different (when angry etc)
